column1: Zhirnovsk (Russian: Жи́рновск) is a town and the administrative center of Zhirnovsky District in Volgograd Oblast
column3: located on the left bank of the Medveditsa River
column4: which itself flows into the Don. Zhirnovsk lies 320 kilometers (200 mi) north of Volgograd
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 16

column1: It was founded in 1958 by merging the villages of Zhirnoye Selo (Жи́рное Село́) and Kurakino Selo (Куракино Село́)
column2: each of which had been founded in their own right in the 17th and 18th centuries. The merger was prompted by the discovery of significant oil deposits near these villages in the 1940s and the consequent establishment of a worker's housing estate in 1954.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Zhirnovsk serves as the administrative center of Zhirnovsky District. As an administrative division
column3: it is incorporated within Zhirnovsky District as the town of district significance of Zhirnovsk. As a municipal division
column4: the town of district significance of Zhirnovsk is incorporated within Zhirnovsky Municipal District as Zhirnovskoye Urban Settlement.

column2: oil and gas processing remains the towns chief industry.
